definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: He is a man of uncommon acquirements.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个才艺出众的人。

sentences.english: Too bad, you best talent is squirting milk from your nose.
sentences.chinese: 我看大家最好的才艺展示就是从鼻子里喷牛奶了。

sentences.english: The talent show in the evening drew the curtain with guitar playing.
sentences.chinese: 晚间的才艺表演在吉它的弹唱中拉开序幕。

sentences.english: Amateur talent activities and disco in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 晚上是业余才艺表演和迪斯科舞。

sentences.english: How romatic! You can not only show your talent but also win MM's love.
sentences.chinese: 不但能展现你的才艺，而且又能获得MM的芳心。

sentences.english: Soon I was competing in talent shows.
sentences.chinese: 很快我就开始在才艺比赛中暂露头角。

sentences.english: So they can show their latents to the publice.
sentences.chinese: 这些女孩可以在公众面前展示她们的才艺了。

sentences.english: There were no differences between educational expectation of parents and after-school learning.
sentences.chinese: 父母教育期望对儿童才艺补习并无显著影响。

sentences.english: During the talent portion, my voice broke when I went to go for a high note.
sentences.chinese: 在才艺表演部分，我在唱高音段时走音了。

sentences.english: I'm willing to be a volunteer in the Chinese New Year Talent Show.
sentences.chinese: 我愿意加入才艺表演筹备小组，或担任服务人员。

sentences.english: I enjoy watching all kinds of wonderful speciality performances given by elaborately dressed-up competitors.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢看精心打扮的选手们表演各种各样的精彩才艺。

definition: can sing and dance (idiom); fig. a person of many talents
the four arts (zither, Go, calligraphy, painting)/the accomplishments of a well-educated person
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
